item.title: pam exec
item.description: PAM, the Linux Pluggable Authentication Modules, allows you to execute programs and scripts when SSH sessions are opened and closed. # /etc/pam.d/sshd session optional pam_exec.so /path/to/script.sh# /path/to/script.sh #!/bin/bash if [ $PAM_TYPE = "open_session" ]; then # fi exit 0 WARNING: Botching your script or failing to return 0 will cause SSH login to fail. Don’t lock yourself out, test your script!
